intro: Physospermum kopetdaghense, commonly known as the Kopetdagh physospermum, is a rare flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are finely divided, and the flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
